titlestmt.titleproper: Pueblo, Colo. Christ Congregational Church records, 1955-2023.
titlestmt.author: Zachary Bodnar

maintenanceevent.eventdescription: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Monday May 13, 2024 at 18:55

did.unittitle: Pueblo, Colo. Christ Congregational Church records, 1955-2023.
did.abstract: In 1955, Rev. Hoy of the First Congregational Church in Pueblo suggested that the residents of the developing Belmont neighborhood should consider establishing a "liberal" protestant church. The Christ Congregational Church was formally incorporated on February 11, 1957. The church building was designed by Elizabeth Wright Ingraham and Gordon Ingraham and construction was completed on the building in August, 1957. The church's membership rose significantly during the 1960s and dropped during the 1970s. During the 1980s, Pueblo's first female minister, Rev. Karen Sorensen, was installed as pastor of the church. During the 1990s, the church adopted the Open and Affirming designation. The membership declined during the 2000s and eventually dissolved in 2023. This collection contains records related to the administration and community of the church and includes meeting minutes, annual reports, financial and building records, membership records, and newsletters.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is unrestricted and open to the public.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Items in this collection are subject to U.S. Copyright Law. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine the copyright status of collection items and to secure any permissions necessary for their reproduction and publication. Requests for permission to publish material must be discussed with the archivist or librarian.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], in the Pueblo, Colo. Christ Congregational Church records, 1955-2023, RG5485. The Congregational Library & Archives, Boston, MA.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were donated to the Congregational Library & Archives by the Christ Congregational Church in October 2023; 2023-51.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Zachary Bodnar, May 2024, using Describing Archives: A Content Standard.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: During the 1950s, Pueblo, Colorado, saw a massive 43% increase in its population. In 1955, in the midst of the population boom, Rev. Hoy of the First Congregational Church in Pueblo suggested that the residents of the developing Belmont neighborhood should consider establishing a "liberal" protestant church. In 1956, Rev. William Shafer was called to eventually lead this church. The first church service, held in the basement of the parsonage, the first building constructed for the church, on September 16, 1956. The church was formally incorporated on February 11, 1957 as the Christ Congregational Church.

The church building was designed by Elizabeth Wright Ingraham, the granddaughter of Frank Lloyd Wright, and her husband, Gordon Ingraham. The original design called for a triangular building with three distinct wings, though only the first wing was ever constructed. Construction of the building was completed in August, 1958. The first worship, and dedicatory service, was held in the newly constructed church building on September 14, 1958.

The church's membership rose significantly during the 1960s, to a height of 600 members in 1963. The church community was very active at the time, with three youth groups, a Boy Scouts troop, a couple's club, and the Women's Fellowship. The 1970s saw a downturn in membership. During the 1980s, Pueblo's first female minister, Rev. Karen Sorensen, was installed as pastor of the church. While some members left over the decision to install Sorensen, the church overall saw growth during her ministry. The early 1990s saw a similar situation with the church's eventual decision to adopt the UCC's Open and Affirming designation; while some members left over the decision, other came to join the church owing to its liberal designation.

The late 1990s and 2000s saw the church's membership shrink significantly again, owing in part to changes in Belmont's demographics and controversies that arose around Rev. Sorensen that precipitated her eventual departure from the church. The church continued to serve the Pueblo community as a liberal protestant church until 2023 when the church voted to dissolve.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains the administrative records of the Christ Congregational Church in Pueblo, Colorado, as well as records documenting the church community. The collection includes meeting minutes, annual reports, baptismal records, membership records and directories, financial records, building records and blueprints, photographs, records of events, and newsletters.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has been arranged into the three series, and three subseries, listed below. Within each series and subseries, materials have been arranged in chronological order and topic, when appropriate.

phystech.head: Technical Requirements
phystech.p: A computer with a disk drive is required to directly view digital contents found on compact disks.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records related to the administrative history of the Christ Congregational Church in Pueblo, Colorado. This series includes church council meeting minutes, annual reports, committee minutes and reports, church histories, letters and communications, and records related to the closure of the church.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Some loose materials were removed from this register and placed in the folder titled "Membership updates, 1969-1970" for the purposes of preservation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records related to the finances and property of the Christ Congregational Church in Pueblo, Colorado. This series includes financial records, legal property documents, records related to memorials, records related to the sale of property, blueprints and records related to construction and renovations, and capital campaign records.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records related to the members and community of the Christ Congregational Church in Pueblo, Colorado. This series includes photographs, membership records, such as vital records and member directories, and records related to community events and programs held by the church.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains photographs, and other types of photographic materials, related to the community and members of the Christ Congregational Church in Pueblo, Colorado.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains records related to the membership of the Christ Congregational Church in Pueblo, Colorado. This subseries includes membership lists and directories, baptismal records, transfer letters, surveys and results, and profiles about the church.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: These materials were removed from the back of the "Church register, 1957-1969" for preservation purposes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains records related to events, programs, and various happenings held by the community of the Christ Congregational Church in Pueblo, Colorado. The subseries includes programs, planning documents for events, examples of materials disbursed at events, and records related to various projects undertaken by the church community.
